<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 774, 90]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the speed of a small trolley moving down a sloping ramp.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment which will enable her to compare the effect of different angles of slope on the average speed of the trolley between points on the ramp.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 551, 166]]<|/det|>
Average speed can be calculated from the equation:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 186, 771, 217]]<|/det|>
\[\text{average speed} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{time}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 227, 398, 244]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 257, 144, 274]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 798, 274]]<|/det|>
a long ramp with a support that enables it to be set at different angles of slope

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 276, 291]]<|/det|>
• a small trolley.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 305, 225, 322]]<|/det|>
In your plan:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 457, 352]]<|/det|>
• list any additional apparatus needed

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 365, 918, 399]]<|/det|>
• explain briefly how to do the experiment, including how to take the measurements so that the average speed can be determined

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 413, 831, 431]]<|/det|>
• suggest a possible source of inaccuracy even if the method is carried out carefully

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 444, 485, 462]]<|/det|>
• state the key variables to keep constant

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 475, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
• draw a table, or tables, with column headings, to show how to display the readings (you are not required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 521, 606, 539]]<|/det|>
• explain how to use the readings to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 552, 576, 570]]<|/det|>
You may draw a diagram if it helps to explain your plan.
